intro: Hieracium vulgatifolium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 50 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Hieracium vulgatifolium is an annual or biennial plant that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by the wind.
